greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of digits of n which are divisors of n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(35)=1 because 5 is a divisor of 35 but 3 is not.
maple: f:= proc(n) local L; L:= convert(n,base,10);
nops(select(t -> t > 0 and n mod t = 0, L))
mathematica: Array[Count[Position[Most@ DigitCount@ #, _?(# > 0 &)][[All, 1]], k_ /; Mod[#, k] == 0] &, 105] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 23 2019 *)
program: $ map ((mod n) . digitToInt) $ filter (> '0') $ show n
(MAGMA) [#[c:c in Intseq(k) |not IsZero(c) and k mod c eq 0]:k in [1..105]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Dec 23 2019
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 04 2000
